title: Amazing Holidays in Shimla - Queen of Hills
text:
Travel Articles | August 10, 2015 
Shimla or in British Indian orthography, Simla, is the capital city of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh, located in northern India. 
Located in the northern India, Shimla is the capital city of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. The city is the host of the South Asia's biggest event of bike racing that is MTB Mountain Bike Racing. It is the most visited hill station as comparable to others hill stations in the Indian state of the Himachal Pradesh. In earlier times during the British Raj era, Shimla is also the British Empire's Summer Capital. 
The city is named Shimla after the Hindu Goddess Shyamala Devi, an epitome of Goddess kali. It is also the capital of undivided Punjab until the origination of new capital of Chandigarh which is now the joint capital of Punjab and Haryana. Shimla is the Legislative as well as Administrative capital of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh. The city is the house to the several research institutions, academic institutions, colleges and universities within the provincial alignments of the capital. It is the gigantic district of Kinnaur valley. 
Shimla is the headmost hill station of the state as well as the country of India, it was assured in 1903. The city of Shimla had a glorious past as well as a majestic present. And the magnificent Budget Hotels in Shimla betwixt the hills are just awesome. The city subjugates the eastern Himachal Pradesh with its glittering snowy mountains and gratifying mountainous destinations. 
Attractions Of Shimla 
There are a plenty of tremendous destinations present in the Capital city of the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh for which a number of domestic as well as international explorers from all over the world comes to the country of India and get lure over the fascinators of Shimla. Here we have mentioned some of the glittering jewels from the garland of the Queen of Hills, which include: Christ Church, Himalayan Bird Park, Viceregal Lodge and Botanical Gardens, Kali Bari Mandir, Chadwick Falls, Summer Hills, Rothney Castle, Jakhu Temple, Sri Guru Singh Sabah Gurdwara, The Ridge of Shimla. 
Climate of Shimla 
The city exhibits a subtropical highland climate. It features chilly winters and mild summers. 
Culture of Shimla 
The city acquires a rich and heritage culture of different tribes and religions that follows their respective traditions with full devotion and freedom to do so. The heavy amount people of Shimla use to wear salwar- kurta and kameez or chadiyan a long knee length gown. Shimla still remains the traditional glamor along with the modernization. 
Specialty of Shimla 
Tourism in industry plays an effective role in the economy of the city however education sector is the major contributor to the economy due to the high quality education and schooling. Students from several states across the country love to study in Shimla concerning to its quality of education provided and it broadly contributes in the income of the district and the state. 
Shimla is notable for academic institutions which includes Indian institute of Advanced Studies, Himachal Pradesh University, University Institute of Information Technology (UIIT) etc. Many notable people from bollywood and government of India are educated in Shimla which include present vice president of India - Mohammad Hamid Ansari, Bollywood peoples- PreetiZinta, NeetuKapoor, AmrishPuri,AnupamKher, and writer Ruskin Bond. 
Travel Tips Of Shimla 
Do pack your woolen clothes of light weight and make prior bookings of flight, buses, cars and hotels to avoid any kind of grievances as the city lies in the south-western ranges of the Himalayas.
